title: Product Marketing Specialist - Automotive Aftermarket
description:
### **Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges**


The **Product Marketing Specialist – Automotive Aftermarket** is responsible for supporting the offering management related activities within Mobile Air Conditioning (MAC) business unit within Fluorine Products. Specific focus will be on the automotive aftermarket and new product introduction programs.  

  

As a **Product Marketing Specialist** here at Honeywell, you will play a crucial role in driving the offering management function. You will be responsible for developing and executing offering strategies to drive growth and profitability. Your strong analytical skills, strategic thinking, and ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams will be essential in delivering successful outcomes for Honeywell's business.

**Relocation assistance is offered for this role to sit in Morris Plains NJ.**

**For more information about the products that you will support, please visit: https://advancedmaterials.honeywell.com/us/en/products/air-conditioning-refrigeration-and-heating/solstice-hfos/solstice-yf-r-1234yf**  

  

**KEY RESPONSIBILITES:**

* Develop new ideas for new product introductions to accelerate growth and profitability
* Manage NPI roadmap to ensure NPI vitality over the STRAP period
* Lead NPI projects in the region
* Report NPI financial metrics to management
* Run the NPI gate review process
* Conduct VOCs and develop key relationships across the value chain
* Utilize marketing toolkit including value propositions, SAM, TAM, GTM strategies, value chain mapping and segmentation to evaluate new opportunities
* Work cross functionally with customer marketing, sales, R&D, finance and ISC
* Support creation of AOP and STRAP by providing strategic forecasts and market intelligence for NPI projects
* Develop US aftermarket value chain identifying profit pools and figuring out ways to extract more value from the chain
* Identify ways to create customer loyalty through advertising, rebate programs and marketing campaigns
* Conduct market research and create updates to highlight key trends and to drive conclusions and actionable recommendations for the business
* Create aftermarket pricing schemes to maximize value and drive new product adoption
* Research competitor’s offerings and market position and identify strategies to protect and gain share
* Prepare and present project and marketing updates to senior management

**Candidate Profile**  

  

The successful candidate will be expected to be a high-energy, creative and resourceful self-starter who demonstrates leadership skills and instincts. He/she is highly intelligent and enthusiastic with a commitment to excellence. In terms of personal competencies, the successful candidate must be a hands-on person who possesses the best combination of strategic thinking and drive to achieve tangible business results. The candidates must be able to balance theoretical thought with practical.
  

  

**BENEFITS OF WORKING FOR HONEYWELL**  

  

* Benefits – Medical, Vision, Dental, Mental Health
* Paid Vacation
* 401k Plan/Retirement Benefits (as per regional policy)
* Career Growth
* Professional Development
 **MUST HAVE**

* 2-3 years experience in a similar role in the automotive industry
* Proven marketing and strategic initiatives, analytical, and implementation skills
* Go-to-market and new product launch experience

**WE VALUE**

* Bachelors degree preferably in an analytical (e.g. economics, math, engineering, marketing, management, etc) or technical discipline (e.g. chemistry, engineering).
* Strategic Marketing Skills: Understanding and experience with the ability to practically apply to their product line. Must link strategies to financial results.
* Leadership: A confident, mature person with the ability to connect with others, and the ability to lead projects and teams that successfully achieve milestones and complete deliverables.
* Results-Oriented: A driver who possesses the ability to take actions and implement effective solutions in a timely manner
* Problem Solver: A creative yet pragmatic problem solver who is methodical and hands-on as well as detail-oriented.
* Analytical Thinking and Decision-Making: A “conceptualizer” of enterprise and market trends/issues who can then integrate that thinking into marketing and business strategies with decisive and logical at thoroughly evaluating issues.
* Excellent planning, execution and project-management skills.
* Teamwork and Interpersonal Skills :A team player and builder who is receptive to ideas from others , shares information and keeps team members and partners informed, works effectively with others to identify and resolve issues, and has excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to interact successfully with a diverse work force.
* Ethics: Highest level of professional integrity and honesty as well as personal credibility.


Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, care or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.  



### **Additional Information**

* **JOB ID:** req465564
* **Category:** Business Management
* **Location:** 115 Tabor Road,Morris Plains,New Jersey,07950,United States
* Exempt

title: Customer Support Representative
description:

**Corporate Coffee Systems is hiring, and we want YOU to be part of our Top-Notch Customer Service Team!**

title: Underwriter
description:
Weichert Financial Services is hiring an Underwriter in Morris Plains, NJ.  



The Underwriter is responsible for reviewing each mortgage loan file submitted for approval consideration, including applicant's work and credit histories, and all liabilities and assets documentation to determine the applicant's credit worthiness. The position uses industry tools such as Fannie Mae & Freddie Mac's (GSE's) automated underwriting systems (AUS) to assist with their decision-making efforts. The Underwriter applies Ability to Repay (ATR) and Qualified Mortgage (QM) standards and uses fraud tools to ensure complete and consistent compliance with federal regulations, Government-Sponsored Enterprises' (GSE's), government agencies, and investors' guidelines. The positions also underwrites Conventional (conforming and non-conforming), USDA, State Bond, and Correspondent mortgage loans.



Job responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following:


* Determines applicants' ability to repay mortgage loan.
* Reviews and verifies income and employment documentation; reviews credit history; reviews assets documentation, and validates that all fits within the underwriting parameters of the selected investor/government agency.
* Reviews appraisal reports and determines if final valuation is accurate and supported according to selected investor's or government agency's guidance, and if they are compliant with ECOA's Valuation Rule. Further ensures that data integrity exists in every appraisal report.
* Updates loan origination system (Encompass) with verified data.
* Scores and/or re-scores loans via GSE's/government agency's AUS, when necessary.
* Consistently meets daily production standards as announced by the VP of Underwriting.
* Reviews all potential adverse action loans with management before notifying Mortgage Advisors and Destination Managers and issuing final decision.
* Ensures that the Mortgage Advisors and Destination Managers are spoken to before issuing a denial; suggests alternatives; prepares counteroffer if applicable, and allows appropriate time for resolution.
* Completes adverse action tasks, when applicable.
* Orders and obtains mortgage insurance, when applicable.
* Maintains a consistent open line of communication with Processors and Mortgage Advisors and Destination Managers, assisting and coaching when necessary.
* Manages a pipeline of loans daily, ensuring that timelines for tasks to be completed are consistently met.
* Returns all phone calls as soon as possible, but no later than by day's end (Sundown Rule).
* Attends and actively participates in regularly scheduled Underwriting Meetings and other meetings as requested by management.
* Reviews and clears conditions when submitted, but no later than 48 hours of submission.
* Consistently maintains superior customer service with both internal and external customers.
* Attends training classes as requested by management.
* Completes ATR & QM testing and ensures loans pass prior to releasing loan to Closing Department.
* Records all conversations and/or updates in the conversation log in Encompass.
* Maintains underwriting consistency, underwriting according to the AUS findings report and/or investor's credit overlays and guidance.
* Ensures that underwriting quality exists with every loan underwritten.
* Responds to and resolves all Quality Control and/or Post-Closing reported underwriting exceptions in the designated timeline.
* Completes required fraud and compliance tests; all alerts, warnings and/or failures must be appropriately addressed before releasing loans to the Closing Department.
* Issues "clear to close" status for loans when the prior to closing conditions have been received and accepted.
* Performs other duties as assigned.

  


#### **Requirements**


The ideal candidate will meet the following requirements:  



**Education, Certification, and License Requirements**


* High School Diploma or GED,
* Associate's or Bachelor's degree preferred


**Experience**


* A minimum of three (3) years of government-related and Jumbo-loan underwriting experience required


**Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities**


* Ability to independently analyze self-employment income tax returns, including all schedules
* Thorough understanding of underwriting/credit policies and procedures
* Solid knowledge of and practical experience with applicable technology tools including but not limited to Microsoft Office suite of products as well as loan origination system (Encompass), AUS, fraud detection and compliance tools
* Ability to handle confidential material in a professional, highly ethical manner
* Time management and organization skills to effectively prioritize multiple objectives and achieve production and turn-around-time goals
* Good verbal and written communication skills are necessary along with good listening skills
* Ability to interact effectively with employees at all levels and from all business units in person or via telephone.
* Solid mathematical skills; ability to calculate income, debt-to-income ratios, and assets required for closing, etc.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving ability

title: Assistant Manager - Full Time (New York - SoHo)
description:
**Why Oak?**

  

OAK + FORT is a fashion and lifestyle brand that provides attainable luxuries consisting of modern essentials in full collections of womenswear, menswear, accessories, jewelry, beauty, and homeware. We are a female-founded and led business that is brought together by a passionate group of people with a natural bond over an aesthetic vision that radiates throughout our collections. From our first studio that opened in 2010 in Vancouver, BC, we now have 40+ locations across North America with a global e-commerce presence.

  

At the heart and core of it all, it’s our people that matter most. We offer a work ethos that is driven by endless passion, intellectual curiosity, and perennial creativity. Here you get the opportunity to influence our global strategy and growth, while working alongside incredibly talented people.

 **What You’ll Do:**

  

As the Assistant Manager you will support with client service, sales, overall productivity, visual merchandising, operations, and people management functions of your store. You will support adherence to store and district goals, operational excellence, alignment with company concepts and culture to drive maximum profitability and compliance with company goals and priorities.

 **What You’re Responsible For:**

 ***Sales Generation***

* Meet minimum sales requirements based on store volume (corporate goal)
* Provide exceptional client experience by executing OAK+FORT Sales Culture
* Build and manage client relationships through client database recording
* Be a brand ambassador by keeping up with new arrivals, product knowledge, and wearing current merchandise
* Provide industry knowledge through awareness of products and prices in the market
* Drive sales through OAK+FORT eCommerce purchases and social media platforms
* Maximize sales during special events and customer services
* Ensure store team processes cash desk operations with engagement, efficiency, and accuracy
* Respond and appropriately resolve customer complaints and service opportunities

 ***Staff Development***

* Source and hire top candidates to build a high performing team
* Build and maintain relationships with store team, peers, and relevant partners
* Train and develop high performing staff to maximize productivity
* Provide timely feedback and active informal training to staff
* Inspire and motivate team through demonstrating leadership qualities
* Ensure staff are adhering to OAK+FORT Sales Culture and service expectations
* Initiate and communicate team objectives and updates with Management team and corporate partners
* Participate in the monthly Manager’s meetings

 ***Store Functionality***

* Participate in training and execution of floor management
* Ensure the right quantity of stock is in the right place at the right time
* Maintain proper presentation of merchandise in accordance with corporate directives
* Oversee stock room set-up and organization
* Ensure stock team ships and receives merchandise with accuracy and efficiency
* Support cleanliness and maintenance of physical store to create a safe and comfortable shopping experience
* Adhere to loss prevention policies to prevent external and internal theft

 **What We’re Looking For:**

  

* Retail leadership experience leading a similar volume location
* Ability to influence and drive results through others
* Strong business acumen
* Ability to communicate and coach effectively
* Adaptable and resourceful
* Focus on people development and career growth
* Present ideas and recommendations in a professional, organized, and logical manner

 **Why You’ll Love It Here:**

  

* Bonus + commission program
* Extremely generous employee discount starting from day one
* Health and dental benefits (for eligible full-time positions only)
* Paid vacation time off (for eligible full-time positions only)
* An opportunity be a part of our growth journey
* Access to training and development programs
* Work amongst an exceptionally talented team

 **Our Values:**

 **ABOVE + BEYOND**


We strive for something greater than ourselves.

**SELF STARTER**


Entrepreneurship is the mindset that leads to endless curiosity and continuous improvement.

**UNIQUELY YOU**


We practice acceptance through open-mindedness and personal responsibility.

**CHANGE DRIVER**


We embrace change and never fear what’s next.

**PEOPLE POWERED**


At the core of our brand we are powered by each other.

 **Our Hiring Process:**


We strive to provide an outstanding experience to every individual who shows interest in our organization. Our goal is to ensure that you receive clear communication, regular updates and have a dedicated recruiter to support your hiring journey with us. We believe that every candidate journey should be unique, and that honesty, integrity and transparency are carried throughout.

  

Once you’ve submitted your application, here is what you can expect:

  

* A response confirming that we have received your application.
* Your application will be reviewed by our recruitment team.
* We will respond to every application to ensure you know where you stand.
* Only candidates that are selected for an interview will be contacted directly by a recruiter or hiring manager.
* Your first connection is a 30-minute phone interview.
* You can expect potentially two additional interviews with the hiring team.
* We will request references + a background check before moving to a final offer.

  

OAK + FORT is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We are committed to providing a respectful, diverse, and unique approach to hiring individuals in the communities in which we operate – allowing each person to be their authentic selves. Our hiring commitment applies to all candidates and employees regardless of race, ethnicity, citizenship, creed, place of origin, religion, sex, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, family status, marital status, disability, age, and any other protected characteristic.

 *Requests for accommodation due to any disability or any other protected characteristic can be made at any stage of the recruitment process and during employment by contacting our People & Culture team. Employee pay will vary based on factors such as qualifications, experience, skill level, competencies and work location.*

title: Business Office HR Coordinator
description:
**Salary: $25.00 - $26.00 Hourly**  

  

The YMCA of Greater New York is here for all New Yorkers — to empower youth, improve health, and strengthen community. Founded in 1852, today the Y serves a diverse population of more than half a million New Yorkers who learn, grow, and thrive through programs and services at our 24 branches. Community is the cornerstone of the Y. Together, we connect active, engaged New Yorkers to build stronger communities.  

  

To help fulfill our mission, we cultivate a culture of learning, leading, and collaboration to enhance community impact. Through our talented staff and “LEAP” career framework (Leadership, Empowerment, Accountability, Personal Growth), we are committed to a people-first approach that fosters trust, inclusion, growth, and development for all.  

  

The West Side YMCA is seeking a Business Office HR Coordinator. Under the supervision of Business Manager, the Business Office HR Coordinator will provide daily Human Resources, Payroll, and some areas of Financial Business support to the branch(es).  

  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

  

Human Resources Responsibilities  

  

Responsible for the processing of employment and volunteer documents in a timely manner – includes, but is not limited to:

* Entry of employee and volunteer screening into the applicable system.
* Assists with Youth & Family screening and agency processing.
* Assists with conducting new hire orientations/paperwork reviews with new or rehired staff (i.e., Benefit PowerPoint, paperwork, etc.).
* Generates and maintains the supply of New Hire Packets, Status Change forms, etc.
* Data entry into CONNECT: HR is completed timely and accurately.
* Assists with the maintenance and accurate filing of all employee and volunteer files.


Will assist the supervisor to ensure appropriate staff/agencies are notified within the required timeframe regarding the following but not limited to:

* Assists with leave requests, including FMLA, disability, paid family leave, personal leave, etc.
* Helps coordinate medical plan changes, providing staff with benefit summaries and information.
* Provides an overview of health insurance, retirement, direct deposit, etc.
* Provides vacation, sick, and personal benefits upon request.
* Assists with employment verification requests.
* Timely response to unemployment claims in the absence of the supervisor.
* Timely entry of Workers Comp claims in the absence of the supervisor.

  

Assists with tracking training completions for all branch staff to ensure compliance, including, but not limited to, Praesidium Academy Child Abuse, Preventing Sexual Harassment, Cyber Security, Time-Clock Use, etc.  

  

Financial Responsibilities

* Assists in preparing the branch's daily deposits, bank and credit card reconciliation, and reporting. Resolve and track chargebacks.
* Assists in processing accounts payable vouchers and invoices, reconciling with the Accounts Payable system, and updating AP & PO tracking reports. Run open PO and IOH reports to notify branch staff.
* Assists in handling petty cash flow, audit receipts, and preparing account payable reimbursement vouchers.
* Assists in collecting purchasing card documents and submitting them to AO.
* Assists in the distribution of financial reports to all branch department heads.
* Maintains and updates the branch's business office records, including vendor files and business office archives, in accordance with the File Retention guidelines.
* Assists in government contract record keeping and reporting to the agency in a timely manner.

  

Other Responsibilities

* Acts as a backup for the branch's Administrative Assistants (i.e., assisting department heads, distributing mail, etc.).
* Assists the branch with maintaining all office equipment and computers and ordering and managing equipment supplies. Helps create and submit HelpDesk tickets.
* Orders and manages the inventory of the branch's office supplies.

 **Desired Skills & Experience:**

* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience.
* One (1) to Two (2) years of experience in Bookkeeping and/or administrative assistance. Knowledge of Human Resources preferred.
* Strong computer knowledge/skills. Knowledge of HRIS is a plus.
* Detail-oriented and can manage multiple projects simultaneously.
* Must be able to handle a high volume of work.
* Excellent customer service and communication skills.

 **Benefits:**  

The YMCA of Greater New York offers a variety of benefits to its staff members, including retirement benefits, medical, paid time off, free YMCA membership, and more! Benefit eligibility is determined by an individual’s employment status (i.e., full-time or part-time), tenure, and/or the number of hours scheduled to work. Click here for more information.  

  

**How to Apply:**  

If you would like to be a member of our dynamic team, please complete our online application and submit your résumé and a thoughtful cover letter that explains your interest in the role and our organization.  

  

If you are a current YMCA employee, please submit your application through the Internal Career Site in Cornerstone.

title: Slide Attendant - Water Park
description:
American Dream, developed by Triple Five Group, is an unparalleled mix of world-class entertainment, retail, and dining, comprising more than 3 million square feet just minutes away from New York City in East Rutherford, New Jersey. American Dream is home to leading attractions, including DreamWorks Water Park, Nickelodeon Universe Theme Park, LEGOLAND Discovery Center, SEA LIFE Aquarium, Big SNOW Ski Hill, Dream Wheel – a 300-foot observation wheel overlook the NYC skyline, as well as attractions debuting soon such as The Game Room Powered by Hasbro and Skip Barber Racing Go-Kart Academy. American Dream’s immersive luxury shopping and dining experience – The Avenue – features Saks Fifth Avenue, Hermès, Saint Laurent,Dolce & Gabbana, Carpaccio, a fine-dining Italian restaurant, and much more. The retail collection is further expanded with flagship locations for Aritzia, H&M, PRIMARK, Uniqlo, Sephora and Zara; as well as the Toys'R'Us global flagship, the only standalone location in the U.S, and the world’s first and only “candy department store,” IT’SUGAR.
  
  

For more information on American Dream, visit www.americandream.com or find us on Instagram @americandream and TikTok @americandream\\_official.
  
  

**KEY OBJECTIVE(S):**  

* Waterpark Attendants are responsible for providing guests with an exceptional experience while ensuring safe and proper use of the waterslides and facility.


**PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:**  

* Supervising the tops of water slides and entries to specific waterpark attractions
* Instructing and reinforcing the safe and proper use of waterpark attractions to our guests
* Responding to minor first aid situations, following health, safety, and emergency


procedures, and calling appropriate personnel for major first aid concerns
  
* Assisting with cleaning the pool, pool areas, slides and staff areas as required.
* Assisting guests with questions or concerns regarding the facility and waterslides.

**DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS:**  

* Applicants must be at least 16 years of age.
* Must be friendly, outgoing and enjoy dealing with the public in a fast-paced environment.
* Must have excellent customer service skills and have an interest in aquatics.
* Previous swimming and aquatics experience is considered an asset.
* This is a part-time position that requires flexible availability Monday through Sunday


including days, evenings, weekends, and holidays.
  
* Must be able to pass a basic security clearance.
* Ability to work in a hot and humid environment and in close proximity to water and chlorine.
* Must ensure all required certifications remain current throughout employment.


**PHYSICAL JOB REQUIREMENTS:**  

* Must be able to lift at least 40 pounds.
* Kneel and bend – occasionally.
* Ability to push/pull cart with 20 pounds of force.
* Standing for extended periods of time.

description:
American Dream, developed by Triple Five Group, is an unparalleled mix of world-class entertainment, retail and dining, comprising more than 3 million square feet just minutes away from New York City in East Rutherford, New Jersey. For more information on American Dream, visit www.americandream.com or find us on Instagram @americandream and TikTok @americandream\\_official.
  
  

**KEY OBJECTIVE(S):****The main purpose of the Rides Maintenance Tech is:**  

* Maintain, inspect troubleshoot and repair all rides and attractions within Nickelodeon Universe Amusement Park. Ensure all rides and equipment comply with equipment manufacturers’ operating standards and requirements.


**PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:**  

* Complete inspections based on Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) and individual requirements, including, but not limited to, mechanical, pneumatics, hydraulics, lubrication system.
* Complete annual inspections according to OEM and regulatory requirements.
* Ability to work on ride controls systems for understanding and troubleshooting.
* Respond to corrective maintenance calls in a timely and professional manner, adhering to all American Dream policies.
* Perform timely and efficient repairs on all ride systems according to OEM requirements.
* Document all preventive maintenance, corrective maintenance, and projects within the CMMS system (Mobaro), including troubleshooting, identification, and completion steps.
* Communicate directly with manufacturers and support services in a professional manner, adhering to all American Dream policies.
* Understand and follow all safety guidelines identified by American Dream.
* Complete all required Ride Mastery Sign-off (RMS) requirements, achieving qualification and sign-off ability for each individual ride. Train new technicians at qualified rides to perform work.
* Maintain assigned tools, returning all tooling and equipment as received.
* Lead by example, providing a positive atmosphere for guests and team members alike.
* Work as a team to bring Nickelodeon Universe to life.
* Perform all other duties as assigned.


**DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS:**  

* 3+ years of mechanical and electrical experience OR completion of a certified technical program and 1+ years of mechanical or electrical experience.
* NAARSO or AIMS certification (or must obtain within 2 years of employment)
* Practical knowledge in one or more of the following disciplines: electrical, pneumatics, fabricating, mechanical, hydraulics, welding, machining, and electronics.
* Required: Practical understanding and safe usage of mechanical tools.
* Preferred: Practical understanding and safe usage of electrical diagnosis tools.
* Proficient oral and written communication required.
* High school diploma or equivalent required


**PHYSICAL JOB REQUIREMENTS:**  

* Perform repetitive motion- infrequently 10% of time
* Stand and move- frequently 90% of time
* Reach at, above or below shoulder level- frequently 75% of time.
* Kneel and bend- frequently 50% of time
* Stoop/squat- occasionally 20% of time
* Lift/carry between 10-75 lbs occasionally 25% of time
* Able to work at heights between 10-85 ft infrequently 20 % of time
* Able to walk stairs at heights between 10 to 100+ feet- Infrequently, 10% of time

Create and promote a safe working environment

Leadership qualities

title: Research Coordinator
description:
Location: "West Orange, NJ" view map

The position’s primary focus is to oversee research activities — including participant recruitment, enrollment, and IRB correspondence, as well as assist with functional and clinical data collection— for clinical trials, funded by the Department of Defense and NIDILRR grants, to investigate the effects of cognitive integrated motor training on ambulation in persons with traumatic brain injury and older adults with mild cognitive impairment, respectively.

**Responsibilities include**
* Facilitate participant recruitment, enrollment, and scheduling for multiple studies.
* Facilitate participant engagement by meeting with local clinic personnel and leaders of local non-profit organizations and support groups to promote research projects.
* Develop promotional material for projects for broad dissemination.
* Communicate effectively with doctors to ascertain the appropriate medical records.
* Prepare reports on recruitment and enrollment status for each study to be presented at internal meetings, in progress reports, and in external publications.
* Perform functional and clinical assessments.
**Qualifications**
* Bachelor’s degree in social sciences, health sciences, or communications (e.g., Psychology, Biology, Public Health).
* A minimum of three years of related research experience.
* Experience communicating with people with disabilities and/or other chronically ill populations and/or their families.
* Excellent communication, organizational, time management, and problem-solving skills.
* Very strong interpersonal skills.
* Strong ability to work both independently and collaboratively.
* Advanced proficiency in Microsoft applications, including Excel and PowerPoint.
* Access to reliable transportation, with ability to travel between West Orange and other locations in northern NJ as needed.
**Preferred qualifications**
* Experience with recruitment of persons with disabilities for research studies.
* Experience in a clinical/research setting working with people with disabilities and/or other chronically ill populations and/or their families.
* Experience with project/study coordination and working closely with a Principal Investigator/team leader.
* Master’s degree in social sciences, health sciences, or communications (e.g., Psychology, Public Health).
**To apply**
Forward your résumé (MS Word or PDF), salary requirements, and cover letter to career@KesslerFoundation.org. Please indicate the position(s) for which you are applying in the subject line.

title: Warehouse Associate - Afternoon Shift
description:
**Looking for a job that's as satisfying as your morning cup of joe? You're in luck!**  
Corporate Coffee Systems is hiring, and we want YOU to be part of our warehouse crew!

Centrally located in Westbury, Long Island, CCS is a leading New York metropolitan coffee, refreshment, and breakroom supplier. We provide a world-class product line and Micro-Market technologies to bring that coffee-house feeling to our clients in the tri-state area. Our specialty is a full line of name-brand refreshment products and business supplies that our clients can trust.

**Here’s what you’ll be doing:**  
You’ll help keep our bustling warehouse running smoothly by picking and packing orders, restocking products, controlling inventory, and handling daily shipments.

**What Else?**

* Our afternoon schedule is Monday through Friday, 12 noon to 8:30 PM.

* We’ll provide snazzy uniforms!
* No experience is necessary—just bring your positive attitude and willingness to learn! If you have electric power jack or forklift experience, that’s a plus!

At Corporate Coffee Systems, we believe in inclusivity. Everyone is welcome here, no matter who you are or where you're from! We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity and expression, marital status, and any other characteristic protected under applicable State or Federal laws and regulations.

**Ready to join our team?**

If you’re prepared to work hard and be part of a dynamic, inclusive environment where every day is fueled by great coffee and positivity, we want to hear from you! Apply today and kickstart your career with Corporate Coffee Systems! EOE. No Agencies or phone calls please.

description:

We are looking for a **Delivery/Route Driver** to support our clients throughout Manhattan, Long Island, New Jersey and Connecticut. We offer an appealing balance of competitive wages, benefits and a safe, family-oriented work environment.

title: IT Manager
description:
At Hyatt, we believe our guests select Hyatt because of our caring and attentive associates who are focused on providing authentic hospitality and meaningful experiences to each and every guest. Hyatt is a place where high expectations aren't just met-they're exceeded. It's a place of outstanding rewards, where talent opens doors to exciting challenges in the hospitality industry.

**Join our amazing team at Hyatt Regency Morristown** which is situated in the heart of downtown Morristown’s historical district near George Washington’s Headquarters, The Morris Museum, and Fosterfields Living Historical Farm. Our newly renovated hotel features 256 guestrooms including 50 spacious studio suites. With more than 31,000 square feet of revitalized meeting and banquet space, the hotel provides premier meeting experience in the Tri-State area.

**What are additional benefits working at Hyatt Regency Morristown**

* Complimentary hotel nights and discounts at Hyatt properties around the world
* Medical insurance benefits for you and your dependents 30 days after joining
* Tuition Reimbursement and 401K/Employee Stock Purchasing Plan
* Free parking/ free meal

The Information Technology Analyst is responsible for maintaining current systems, upgrading future systems, maintaining inventories, conducting on-site training to promote efficient operations and answer questions to avoid or resolve systems-related problems, establish policies and procedures, purchase operating equipment, budgeting computer related items, and maintain relationships with corporate office and Hyatt technology support team. Work also involves conferring with programmers, application experts and computer operators in order to exchange information and resolve problems regarding daily operation of various applications systems, report generation, system enhancements, system failures and related issues.

Successful candidates will have strong leadership, professionalism, interpersonal and communication skills and a minimum of two years with WAN/LAN infrastructure and property.

Hyatt associates work in an environment that demands exceptional performance yet reaps great rewards. Whether it's career opportunities, job enrichment or a supportive work environment, if you are ready for this challenge, then we are ready for you.

title: Social Work Student Intern Supervisor
description:
The YWCA of the City of New York (YWCA NYC) is dedicated to eliminating racism, empowering women, and promoting peace, justice, freedom and dignity for all. Established in 1858, the YWCA NYC is one of the nation’s oldest nonprofit organizations committed to the personal and social development of women, their families, and their communities. In honor of this history, and in service of our mission, the YWCA NYC currently provides leadership and advocacy training for young women through our Girls Initiatives program, and youth development through our Out-of-School Time (OST) program for elementary and middle school students in culturally diverse communities in Brooklyn and Manhattan.

The YWCA-NYC’s OST Programs empower the community by giving children the necessary tools to succeed in all facets of life. This is accomplished through creating strong partnerships with the schools, families, children, and community leaders. We strive to positively impact our school community by providing support to children academically, socially, culturally, and physically through a strong model of youth development.

We are seeking a Social Work Student Intern Supervisor to join our team to provide services at our school- based programs providing direct services to children in elementary and middle school OST programs. The position is from September through June, with potential opportunities for continued part-time or full-time employment. The ideal candidate will have experience in providing counseling services to children and adolescents with different behavioral and mental health diagnoses. This Clinician will be providing group, individual, and family therapies to a select caseload of students, in the school building, during school hours. This Clinician will work closely with school and YW-NYC staff and collaborate closely with their identified supervisor and team and will provide field instructions to 3-6 social work student interns.

**Responsibilities:**

* Conduct one hour of field instruction per week for 6 social work students, totaling 3-4 sessions each month.
* Oversee student learning, which includes reviewing process recordings, evaluations, and agency documentation.
* Conduct assessments and evaluations to determine the needs of clients
* Provide risk assessments with necessary supervision.
* Maintain accurate records of client progress and treatment plans
* Provide individual and group counseling to students and provide psychosocial support in integrated contexts throughout the school day.
* Co-lead social cognition and psychosocial groups and provide psychosocial guidance in classrooms.
* Develop and implement treatment plans based on client needs
* Provides consultation and facilitates referrals to appropriate levels of care and specialized services based on the student's needs.
* Deliver clinical interventions consistent with the needs of the student and family, in a safe and ethical manner that promotes and sustains academic and mental health stability.
* Onsite coaching of Interns

**Other Duties:**

* Optimizes the collaboration and coordination of the interdisciplinary team to enhance the environment of student care.
* Provides family programming with monthly evening Parent Support groups, as needed.
* Provide crisis intervention services as needed

**Requirements**

* Must have an active clinical license, either an LMSW or LCSW and a minimum of three years of post-master’s experience.
* Must have a SIFI certification.
* Must have 2+ years of experience treating children and/or adolescents with significant behavioral and emotional challenges.
* Effective problem solving and communication skills.
* Experience working with students and families, plus community health and social service agencies.
* Must be proficient in Microsoft Office and comfortable using a computer.
* Must be able to complete thorough clinical documentation.
* Strong conflict management skills
* Ability to collect and analyze data effectively
* Familiarity with special education practices and policies
* Proficient in psychotherapy techniques including cognitive behavioral therapy
* Ability to work with individuals with special needs
* Bilingual in English / Spanish A+
* Must obtain the following clearances
* The NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services (DCJS) Sex Offender Registry (SOR),
* The New York City Department of Health and Mental Hygiene (DOHMH).
* The New York State Central Registrar (SCR)
* The New York State Staff Exclusion List (SEL).
* Criminal History Review
* Ability to maintain clearance of the above throughout employment.
* Must participate in 5-hour Foundations in Health and Safety and Mandated Reporter training.
* Must receive CPR certificate within one month of employment.

**Qualifications:**

* Passion for working with children
* Desire and ability to work with students with special needs
* Ability to connect with elementary school- age children
* Demonstrates competency in: Group Therapy, Individual Counseling, and Family Counseling.
* Understands continuum of mental health services, referring students and family to an appropriate level of care in coordination with their supervisor (such as: substance abuse services and/or IOP/PHP/In-Patient)
* Demonstrates a commitment to developing strong working relationships with YW-NYC staff, school administration, district leadership, teachers, and paraprofessionals.
* Knowledge of various clinical interventions and use of a collaborative approach to meet the unique needs of each child
* Positive attitude and demeanor with an ability to engage individuals of diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and needs.
* Effective oral and written communication skills
* A solid understanding of adolescent-age children’s academic, social, and emotional development
* Maintaining confidentiality and privacy
* Time management and the ability to multitask
* Teamwork and collaboration
* Attention to detail
* Ethical conduct

**Job Type:** Full Time

**Salary:** $75-$85

**Expected hours:** 10 – 25 per week

**To Apply:** Please submit a resume and a cover letter that addresses your qualifications and ability to fulfill the responsibilities outlined above, as well as your salary requirements, to hr@ywcanyc.org

The hours for this position will fluctuate depending on the school's needs, general operation hours can range from 9:00am – 7:00pm. This role requires occasional travel across New York City.

**Physical Demands:**

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and listen. This position is very active and requires standing, walking, bending, kneeling, and stooping all day. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move items under 20 pounds. During fire drills, the employee, unless physically unable, will need to use the stairs to go to ground level from the fourth floor. Typing is required for composing emails and writing reports. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

The YWCA of the City of New York is an equal opportunity employer and contractor. We provide equal employment and contracting opportunities to all applicants for employment and prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

title: Global Partner Seller
description:
**Company Description**  

It all started in sunny San Diego, California in 2004 when a visionary engineer, Fred Luddy, saw the potential to transform how we work. Fast forward to today — ServiceNow stands as a global market leader, bringing innovative AI-enhanced technology to over 8,100 customers, including 85% of the Fortune 500®. Our intelligent cloud-based platform seamlessly connects people, systems, and processes to empower organizations to find smarter, faster, and better ways to work. But this is just the beginning of our journey. Join us as we pursue our purpose to make the world work better for everyone.

 **Job Description**  

This role is part of Service Now’s Global Partner and Channels (GPC) organization, dedicated to enabling & accelerating rapid growth through NOW’s partner ecosystem. As a Global Partner Seller – Run (GPS-R), you will play a key role in managing an existing base of partner’s managed service provider business on ServiceNow. This position is a sales role that demands a highly motivated individual with strong sales, communications, and organizational skills that is eager to learn and become part of a rapidly growing company.  

  

The Global Partner Seller will manage an existing sell-through revenue base with a designated/dedicated partner to ensure healthy growth in those accounts while also driving new opportunities that is led by the partner. This will be achieved by account planning, forecasting, using business development techniques and field-based sales activities.  

  

**Critical to this role:**

* Achieve Net New Sell-through (service provider and resell) sales quotas for allocated partner on a quarterly and annual basis
* Interface with end customer account team and partner stakeholders across time zones to drive deal execution including executing contracts renewal and managing de-bookings.
* Pipeline management, sales process management including effective forecasting and opportunity closures.
* Driving end to end deal execution from order form creation, pricing, negotiation (supported by leadership) to signing the deal and proactively following up on any account receivables with respect to sell-through business with the partner.
* Arranging and conducting initial product demonstrations, EBCs, and presentations by collaborating with cross-functional teams (partner and field account) to drive prospecting and focusing on customers’ business drivers and use cases along with the partner.
* Educate Field AEs on differentiation of partnership so they can provide more informed decisions to customers. Qualify, develop, and execute new sales opportunities and ongoing revenue streams.
* Ongoing account management to ensure partner satisfaction and to drive additional revenue streams underpinned by defined governance and QBR model.
* Become the trusted advisor to the partner by understanding their existing and future partner road map in IT managed services space with ServiceNow
* Building and maintaining relationships with key partner executives and decision makers
* Cross-sell and upsell in existing accounts and help expand Platform adoption.
* Manage potential field conflicts and develop aligned approaches and resolutions at Executive levels.
* Proactively manage renewals and true ups by working closely with the end customer account team and the partner with an objective to drive upsell and cross-sell into the account.

  

**Qualifications** **In order to be successful in this role, we need someone who has:**

* The ideal candidate will have 5+ years of prior global alliances and partner sales experience including business development in Enterprise Software and/or Cloud Services (including Enterprise SaaS) driving partner revenue & accelerated growth with & through SI-SP partners in collaboration with an enterprise sales force.
* Demonstrable track record of achieving and exceeding sales targets in sell-through motion (service provider/resell)
* Commercially astute, experience in developing business case and ROI together with partner.
* Ability to understand the “bigger picture” and the partners business drivers
* Ability to build strong relationships at all levels of both the partners organizations and internal ServiceNow Sales teams
* Is goal-oriented and confident, with aptitude and desire to work with high-performing teams. This individual must demonstrate an ability to operate in a highly collaborative environment and fosters a “win as a team” environment.
* Diligent at measuring and communicating progress to achieve targeted business results, identifying obstacles and associated remediation plans
* Past experience and relationships with major SI’s, ISV’s, Managed Service Providers, Value Added Resellers and experience with leading software, Cloud & SaaS organizations required
* Bachelor’s degree. MBA degree is a strong plus

*Not sure if you meet every qualification? We still encourage you to apply! We value inclusivity, welcoming candidates from diverse backgrounds, including non-traditional paths. Unique experiences enrich our team, and the willingness to dream big makes you an exceptional candidate!*


For positions in New York City, we offer a base pay of $136,600 - $225,400, plus equity (when applicable), variable/incentive compensation and benefits. Sales positions generally offer a competitive On Target Earnings (OTE) incentive compensation structure. Please note that the base pay shown is a guideline, and individual total compensation will vary based on factors such as qualifications, skill level, competencies and work location. We also offer health plans, including flexible spending accounts, a 401(k) Plan with company match, ESPP, matching donations, a flexible time away plan and family leave programs. Compensation is based on the geographic location in which the role is located and is subject to change based on work location.

 **Additional Information** **Work Personas**


We approach our distributed world of work with flexibility and trust. Work personas (flexible, remote, or required in office) are categories that are assigned to ServiceNow employees depending on the nature of their work. Learn more here.


**Equal Opportunity Employer**


ServiceNow is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status, or any other category protected by law. In addition, all qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with legal requirements.


**Accommodations**


We strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are unable to use this online application and need an alternative method to apply, please contact talent.acquisition@servicenow.com for assistance.


**Export Control Regulations**


For positions requiring access to controlled technology subject to export control regulations, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations (EAR), ServiceNow may be required to obtain export control approval from government authorities for certain individuals. All employment is contingent upon ServiceNow obtaining any export license or other approval that may be required by relevant export control authorities.


From Fortune. ©2024 Fortune Media IP Limited. All rights reserved. Used under license.

title: Pre-op/PACU RN - ambulatory surgery center
description:
#### **Pre-op/PACU RN - ambulatory surgery center**

#### **Job description:**


Are you passionate about healthcare and looking for an ambitious Company to showcase and grow your skills? If you are, Alliance Health System may be a fit for you! Alliance Health System works with the TeamMD Surgical Center in Woodland Park which is known for excellence in surgical care delivery and patient satisfaction. We provide high quality care through compassion to all we serve by creating a support environment for patients, clinical staff and employees.


The Pre-op RN may assume the following responsibilities: work with the nursing team to review and assess pre-op H&P, labs, medication and orders to determine appropriate admission to facility. Experienced and skilled at IV access. Provide pre-op teaching to patients and their families.


The PACU RN is able to manage the airway immediately post-op. The PACU nurse assesses the patient for pain, bleeding and supports the patient through recovery from anesthesia. Post-op teaching is an integral part of ambulatory discharge.


Additional job requirements:

* Ability to deliver indirect and direct patient care according to established standards, taking into consideration the age and risk factors of each individual patient.
* Ability to perform ECGs and waived tests such as pregnancy tests and serum glucose
* Possess the knowledge and ability to use the nursing process to assess, plan, implement, and evaluate the care of the patient.
* Uses nursing judgment in decision-making.

title: Maintenance Technician 2
description:
Description:

For more than 70 years, Heatherwood has been committed to building upscale residential rental communities, commercial properties, and luxury urban spaces. Our commitment to quality constructions, striking designs, and providing exemplary service, makes us one of the most highly regarded leaders in the industry. Additionally, we offer a competitive benefits package including health & dental, and vision insurance, 401(k), and paid PTO.


Heatherwood is on a mission to create high-quality places that inspire a genuine sense of community. As a Maintenance Technician 2 for Heatherwood, you are the driving force in providing great service to our residents in a fast-paced, challenging, and rewarding environment.

**Your Responsibilities:**

* Apply a “Safety First” approach to every day at Heatherwood.
* A minimum experience of 2+ years of multifamily residential, commercial, or hotel maintenance, or similar experience.
* Maintain the property's interior and exterior standards.
* Openness and approachability to feedback and consistent communication
* Understanding and experience with the following mechanical systems, but not limited to: HVAC equipment, plumbing (water heaters, drain clearing, fixture replacement and repair), minor electrical repair, appliance repair, drywall prep and repair, painting, and carpentry.
* Knowledge of building systems including fire sprinklers, fire alarms, and central mechanical/HVAC systems
* Solid understanding of general building maintenance, work order management and apartment make-ready process.
* Ability to effectively troubleshoot and problem solve maintenance issues.
* Shared responsibility of “On-Call” schedule with your property and other Heatherwood property teammates.
* Job responsibility requires standing for extended periods, walking, pushing, lifting up to 50 pounds, bending and reaching, kneeling, stooping, crawling, and climbing.


This list is an example of the Tech II responsibilities but is not an all-inclusive list of job descriptions. Business needs will dictate additional responsibilities.


Requirements:
**What you bring to Heatherwood:**

* A positive attitude
* Reliability and dependability
* Team first approach to every day
* Willingness to learn new tasks.
* A customer first approach to providing world class maintenance and service.
* Ability to take direction from a supervisor and work independently through task completion.
* Commitment to completion of time sensitive tasks.
* Computer and smart phone skills required.
* Effective written and verbal communication.
* Ability to work independently and complete assigned tasks.
* Safe understanding of hand/power tools and use of PPE (Personal Protective Equipment)
* Flexibility to work overtime and weekends.
* Attention to detail and consistently doing the job right the first time.
* Valid driver's license.

**Your Development:**

* Heatherwood Safety Culture – monthly team safety trainings
* CPR certification required at locations with Level 4 Pool Supervision Requirements
* How your success in maintenance contributes to the community's goals
* How to effectively manage your time and communicate in a fast-paced setting.
* Pool and Spa training. Support in obtaining CPO (Certified Pool Operator) certificate.
* HVAC training and support in obtaining HVAC Universal License.
* Ongoing maintenance training and development and internal company growth opportunity.

title: Beauty Marketing Manager
description:
Beauty Marketing Manager


Job Description We are looking for a highly organized and creative Marketing Manager to support our marketing efforts across digital channels, content creation, and social media. This role will work closely with the VP of Brand to implement campaigns that drive performance while managing day-to-day content production and social media strategy. The ideal candidate will have a passion for digital marketing and experience in creating content that engages audiences.


Responsibilities:

* Execute digital marketing campaigns across paid search, social, email, and display channels, with a focus on performance optimization.
* Support the development and implementation of content strategies that align with both digital and organic marketing efforts.
* Manage the day-to-day operations of our social media channels, ensuring engaging and consistent content is delivered.
* Assist in the creation and curation of content, collaborating with internal teams and external vendors to produce high-quality assets.
* Track, analyze, and report on performance metrics across digital, social, and content channels, making recommendations for optimization.
* Implement A/B testing strategies to improve campaign effectiveness and content performance.
* Collaborate with creative and product teams to ensure cohesive messaging across channels.
* Manage relationships with social media influencers and partners to enhance brand reach.
* Stay updated on the latest digital, social, and content trends to bring innovative ideas to the team.

Requirements:  

* Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Communications, or related field.
* 3-5 years of experience in digital marketing, content management, and social media strategy.
* Strong understanding of digital marketing channels (Google Ads, Meta, SEO, email, etc.) and experience managing paid campaigns.
* Proficiency in social media platforms with a track record of growing organic social presence.
* Experience in content creation, including copywriting, graphic design, and video production.
* Excellent analytical skills and experience with marketing tools (Google Analytics, CRM, etc.).
* Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and meet deadlines.
* Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
* Passion for beauty, skincare, and wellness.
*Travel: Occasional travel required domestically to accounts/internationally for trend research or to other SWIM USA offices.*

*Working Conditions: Office - flexible hybrid schedule - required to be in the office 3 days per week.*

*Physical Demands: must be able to stand, sit, walk and climb stairs up to 8 hours per day.*

**SWIM USA is an EOE**

title: Beauty Marketing Director
description:
BEAUTY MARKETING DIRECTOR


Marketing Director - Beauty (Digital, Content, and Social Focus)  

Job Description We are seeking an experienced and innovative Marketing Director to lead our marketing efforts across digital, content, and social media channels. While the primary focus is on driving performance through digital marketing, this role will also manage our overall content strategy and social media presence to ensure an integrated approach to brand growth. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record in digital marketing with experience managing creative content and social strategies in the beauty or skincare industry.


Responsibilities:  

* Lead the development and execution of the marketing strategy across digital, social, and content channels, aligning with business goals and brand objectives.
* Oversee performance-driven digital marketing strategies (paid search, social media ads, email, SEO, etc.) while ensuring cohesion with organic content and social media efforts.
* Manage the content strategy to ensure it supports the brand's messaging and contributes to both performance marketing and brand-building goals.
* Own the marketing calendar and lead campaign planning across all channels, ensuring timely execution.
* Develop and execute social media strategies to increase engagement, brand awareness, and community growth.
* Collaborate with creative, product, and brand teams to develop content that resonates with target audiences and drives engagement across platforms.
* Lead A/B testing efforts to optimize digital campaigns and content performance.
* Analyze performance metrics across channels (CAC, ROAS, LTV, etc.) and make data-driven decisions for continual improvement.
* Manage relationships with agencies and partners to ensure best-in-class campaign execution.
* Manage the marketing budget, allocating resources effectively across digital, content, and social channels.
  

Requirements:  

* Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, or related field.
* 7+ years of experience in marketing, with a strong emphasis on digital marketing and content management.
* Expertise in performance marketing (Google Ads, Meta, SEO, email, etc.) and content strategy.
* Strong knowledge of social media platforms and trends, with experience growing organic social presence.
* Proven ability to lead cross-functional teams and manage complex campaigns
* Experience in data analysis and marketing analytics tools (Google Analytics, CRM, etc.).
* Exceptional project management skills and the ability to manage multiple priorities simultaneously.
* Passion for the beauty and skincare industry.
 *Travel: Occasional travel required domestically to accounts/internationally for trend research or to other SWIM USA offices.*

*Working Conditions: Office - flexible hybrid schedule - required to be in the office 3 days per week.*

*Physical Demands: must be able to stand, sit, walk and climb stairs up to 8 hours per day.*

**SWIM USA is an EOE**

title: Growth Marketing Analyst IV
description:
We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Business Analyst to support our marketing measurement and insights program. The successful candidate will be responsible for delivering business and channel-level analysis and insights, identifying trends to enable optimization, and driving strategic initiatives to identify opportunities for growth. This role requires strong data analysis and market research skills, as well as the ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.


**Key Responsibilities:**


* Develop quantitative analysis, tools, ad hoc reports, scorecards, and models to support marketing decision-making. Analysis areas may include, but are not limited to: opportunity sizing, audience analysis, ROI, retention, sentiment, lifetime value, sales pipeline, revenue, product adoption, and engagement.
* Conduct deep dives into campaign performance to make well-informed decisions and derive key learnings backed by data, ensuring that insights are actionable and aligned with business objectives.
* Partner with marketing, data scientists, data engineers, and product teams to scope, design, execute, track, and improve the impact of marketing efforts.
* Identify and implement streamlined processes for data reporting and communication.


**Required Qualifications:**


* 5+ years of experience in data analytics, marketing analytics, data science, or similar fields, with proficiency in SQL, Hive, or other data querying languages, and Salesforce Marketing Cloud.
* Deep understanding of B2B marketing, including events, partner ecosystems, scaled channels (in-app, email, web, social), sales incentive programs, pipeline measurement, and multi-touch attribution.
* Experience in extracting, cleaning, and manipulating data to build data sets and reports.
* Experience in communicating with cross-functional stakeholders including brand strategists, marketing researchers, product marketing managers, and engineers.
* Proven ability to thrive in ambiguous situations and quickly adapt to deliver results, such as spearheading new projects, supporting product launches, or building new teams.
* Bachelor's degree in Analytics, Marketing Analytics, Data Science, Economics, or equivalent practical experience.


**Preferred Qualifications:**


* Proven track record in leveraging data to influence monetization strategies from a product, organizational, or company-wide perspective. Experience in identifying and executing monetization opportunities that align with strategic goals.
* Statistical modeling and data analysis experience (e.g., significance testing, regression modeling, sampling theory).
* Management consulting experience or a similar career requiring the presentation of data-driven insights to business audiences.


**Location**: New York, NY


**Role type:** Contract 12 Month Position


**Expected hours**: 40 per week


**Benefits:**


* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance


**Schedule:**


* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday


**Application Question(s):**


* Do you or will you in the future require any sponsorship to work in the US?

* English (Required)

title: Client Service Associate
description:
**Job Title:** **Client Services Associate**


**Reports To:** The **Client Services Associate** will report to the Client Services Supervisor, Client Services Manager, or equivalent leadership.

  


**Job Overview:**



The **Client Services Associate** provides exceptional office and mail services, delivering operational functions in the following areas: processing of inbound/outbound mail, distributing/delivering of mail, shipping and receiving product and supplies to support onsite business service center, replenishing/organizing/ordering office supplies (pens, paper, toner), insuring copy/print machines are functional and stocked, serving as a backup to the front of office (reception/concierge), and providing light maintenance/cleaning.



Overall, this position continuously offers the highest level of service to all client and SPS employees while maintaining a professional image of the company by providing prompt, courteous and efficient service.

  


**Duties and Responsibilities:**


* Provides 5-star customer service to all employees (in all forms of communication).
* Receives inbound mail/packages and sorts incoming mail and inputs into chain of custody software package.
* Manages outgoing mail/package transactions.
* Performs duties associated with shipping and receiving of materials.
* Notifies employees upon receipt of inbound deliveries.
* Distributes mail/packages to company personnel.
* Acts as point of contact for company personnel on mail/package inquiries.
* Performs daily key ops of convenience multi-function devices (ensuring functionality, replenish toner/paper).
* Submit work orders for certain requests.
* Service and replenish the barista, pantry, conference, kitchen, or meetings areas.
* Will perform meeting room and conference room set ups.
* May perform building occupant moves within assigned facilities.
* Will perform light maintenance and cleaning duties as assigned.
* Maintains the Business Service Center area in a neat and orderly fashion.
* Monitors level of office supplies on the floor, and replenishing and orders accordingly.
* Assists with copy/print orders and/or monitoring the copy/print equipment for satisfactory functionality.
* Proactively seeks out additional work during downtime.
* Builds professional relationships with customers and other teams.
* Maintains professionalism and composure when interacting with all employees.
* Trains back-up and providing guidance on policies and procedures.
* Determines what additional support is needed when handling sensitive inquiries.
* Provides exceptional customer service to client.
* Provides reception or concierge (front of office) coverage as needed.

  


**Competencies**:


* Strong verbal and written communication skills.
* Excellent customer service skills.
* PC skills MS Office Suite experience.
* Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously.
* Good organizational skills.
* Working knowledge of MFD equipment.
* Requires knowledge and understanding of shipping/receiving procedures and ability to comprehend instructions.
* Possesses ability to work independently and capable of completing projects.
* Ability to determine correct method and packing material as well as validate packing slips for accuracy of incoming and outgoing materials.

  


**Qualifications and Education Requirements:**


* High School Diploma (or equivalent) required.
* 1+ years prior work experience preferred.
* Ability to work assigned work hours determined by manager.
* Excellent organizational and time management skills.
* Analytical abilities and aptitude in problem-solving.
* Superb written and verbal communication skills.
* Current knowledge or ability to learn computer-based systems required for functions of position.
* Required to maintain an overall professional appearance and attitude.
* Adhere to all policies and procedures required.

  


**Physical Demands:**


* Approximately 50% of the time this position requires the below physical demands.
+ Fine and/or gross motor skills, including the ability to grasp, lift and/or carry or otherwise move packages on a standard wheeled cart with a load capacity of 60 lbs.
+ Ability to walk, bend, kneel, stand, and/or sit for an extended period of time.
+ Manual dexterity required for operating office machinery (phone, copy machines, binding equipment, etc.).
+ Ability to lift or move 40 lbs. or greater frequently.

  




**Travel: None or Negligible**

  


**Other Duties:**



This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.


**WHAT WE OFFER**


* **Career Growth:** An opportunity to enter a job that allows you to learn new skills or use a variety of them that may lead you to uncover other career opportunities!
* **Learning & Development:** At SPS, we promote a work culture of learning so that you can develop to be the best at what you do!
* **We Recognize Talent:** We offer a variety of recognition programs for all levels of employees!
* **Benefit Offerings:** Medical, Dental, Vision, HCFSA, DCFSA, HSA, Commuter Transit and Parking, Supplemental Life Insurance, Accident Insurance, Critical Illness, Hospital Indemnity, Legal Program, Identify Theft Protection, Pet Discounts, Pet Insurance, Group Home and Auto Insurance, EAP, Short Term Disability, Life Insurance, Education Discounts, 401k w/ matching, Entertainment Discounts, & Paid Time Off.
	+ Note: Please inquire with the Human Resources team for benefit offerings per role as regular positions that routinely are under 30 hours/week may have a different benefit offering.

**About SPS**


**SPS** is an award-winning employer of choice offering outsourcing solutions that leverage Intelligent Automation (Artificial Intelligence & Robotic Process Automation) in more than 22 countries across the globe.



In North America, our services include Mailroom Management (both physical and digital), Office Services such as Reception, Lobby Concierge and Conference Room Management in addition to Document Processing Services utilizing leading edge technologies. Our clients today are companies in sectors such as banking, insurance, legal, higher education, advertising and other professional services, including many Fortune 500 companies.


**SPS** is committed to delivering high caliber outsourcing experience to our clients and offering our employees challenging and exciting career opportunities throughout the North America region and globally. SPS is committed to investing in the professional development of our employees and offers competitive comprehensive benefits and diverse development training programs that lead to building careers.



At SPS we embrace the uniqueness of our employees and are committed to the fair and equal treatment of all people, applicants, and employees by promoting a culture of access, inclusion, equity and diversity.



SPS provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual and reproductive health choices, national origin, age, disability, genetics, military status, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation and/or any other status protected by law.


**To view our privacy policy, click on the link below:**



SPS-North America Privacy Policy

title: Shipping and Receiving Clerk (Floater)
description:
We have great opportunity for those seeking a new challenge, but also a fantastic place to work. **Come grow with us in New York!**


*SPS offers a competitive benefits package including paid time off, paid holidays, medical, dental, vision, legal and life insurance, transit program, referral bonuses, pet discounts, EAP, and a 401K with company match.*


**Schedule: Typically Monday - Friday, 7:30AM-4:30PM/8AM-5PM (Flexes based on area assisting with)**


**What you will be doing:**


* Giving amazing customer service to our onsite operation by scanning/delivering/tracking/reporting in and outgoing business packages and mail (via UPS, USPS, Fedex, etc).
* Assisting the onsite personnel in retrieving their packages and providing records management in person, by email, by phone, or similar methods.
* Oversee the onsite business center, which may include: office supply stocking, assisting with copy/print orders, conference room setup up, pantry inventory, or light facilities.
* Serves as backup to route driving roles, which provide delivery to onsite personnel for packages, pallets, etc.


**What we need from you:**


* 3+ year experience in shipping & receiving, mailroom, route driving, or similar services.
* Valid U.S. Driver's License, must be at least 25 years old to meet our standards to company car insurance, and have had license for at least 5 years.
* A positive and professional attitude with a willingness to go above and beyond for our customers.
* Previous material handling skills a plus, including ability to use motorized and manual equipment such as forklifts (in locations where they are needed), pallet jacks, and hand trucks.
* **Ability to perform the following types of physical activities: lift up to 50 pounds, push/pull to move equipment, bend/stoop/squat/kneel, and reach above shoulders**
* Background and experience working in a warehouse or loading dock environment, with exposure to varied weather conditions a plus.
* Must be willing to be cross-trained to support all tasks required for that site, including, but not limited to: routes, receiving, mail services, shipping, floaters, freight coordination & logistics, loading dock operations, and customer service/help desk. Must be experienced with and able to troubleshoot issues regarding tracking software, secure lockers, and other tools & technology used by the SRM team. Must remain flexible and ready to support the needs of the business. In some field offices, Supervisors will collaborate with cross functional partners to support waste, secure waste, and eWaste programs.

 **WHAT WE OFFER**


* **Career Growth:** An opportunity to enter a job that allows you to learn new skills or use a variety of them that may lead you to uncover other career opportunities!
* **Learning & Development:** At SPS, we promote a work culture of learning so that you can develop to be the best at what you do!
* **We Recognize Talent:** We offer a variety of recognition programs for all levels of employees!
* **Benefit Offerings:** Medical, Dental, Vision, HCFSA, DCFSA, HSA, Commuter Transit and Parking, Supplemental Life Insurance, Accident Insurance, Critical Illness, Hospital Indemnity, Legal Program, Identify Theft Protection, Pet Discounts, Pet Insurance, Group Home and Auto Insurance, EAP, Short Term Disability, Life Insurance, Education Discounts, 401k w/ matching, Entertainment Discounts, & Paid Time Off.
	+ Note: Please inquire with the Human Resources team for benefit offerings per role as regular positions that routinely are under 30 hours/week may have a different benefit offering.

**About SPS**


**SPS** is an award-winning employer of choice offering outsourcing solutions that leverage Intelligent Automation (Artificial Intelligence & Robotic Process Automation) in more than 22 countries across the globe.



In North America, our services include Mailroom Management (both physical and digital), Office Services such as Reception, Lobby Concierge and Conference Room Management in addition to Document Processing Services utilizing leading edge technologies. Our clients today are companies in sectors such as banking, insurance, legal, higher education, advertising and other professional services, including many Fortune 500 companies.


**SPS** is committed to delivering high caliber outsourcing experience to our clients and offering our employees challenging and exciting career opportunities throughout the North America region and globally. SPS is committed to investing in the professional development of our employees and offers competitive comprehensive benefits and diverse development training programs that lead to building careers.



At SPS we embrace the uniqueness of our employees and are committed to the fair and equal treatment of all people, applicants, and employees by promoting a culture of access, inclusion, equity and diversity.



SPS provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual and reproductive health choices, national origin, age, disability, genetics, military status, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation and/or any other status protected by law.
